items.question: Is there a shuttle bus?
items.answer:
Yes! A bus will depart at {{busTime}} from the main meeting point.
Guests arriving from abroad should plan to be at the meeting point on time.

items.question: Can I bring a plus one?
items.answer: Please check your invitation! If it says 'and Guest,' then yes. Otherwise, we have only reserved a seat for you personally. This includes partners traveling from the UK.

items.question: Are children invited?
items.answer: We love your little ones, but we have decided to make our wedding an adults-only event. We hope you can enjoy a night off to celebrate with us!

items.question: What is the Dress Code?
items.answer: Formal / Cocktail attire. Please avoid wearing white or ivory. Since it is {{weddingDate}} in Spain, we recommend light fabrics and breathable materials to stay cool.

items.question: Is there a Registry or Gift list?
items.answer: Your presence is the greatest gift of all. However, if you wish to honor us with a gift, a contribution toward our honeymoon fund would be greatly appreciated.

items.question: Outdoor or indoor?
items.answer: Both! We will have an outdoor ceremony ({{ceremonyTime}}), followed by cocktails on the terrace and an indoor dinner at {{ceremonyVenue}}. Sunscreen and hats are recommended for those not used to Spainâ€™s July sun.

items.question: What shoes should I wear?
items.answer: The ceremony is on grass, so we recommend avoiding thin stilettos. Wedges, block heels, or fancy flats will be much more comfortable for dancing!

items.question: Do you have special meal options?
items.answer: Of course! When you RSVP, please let us know if you are vegan, gluten-free, have severe allergies, or dietary restrictions common in the UK so our catering team can prepare accordingly.

items.question: Can I take photos?
items.answer: We invite you to be fully present during our ceremony and ask that you keep your phones away. During the party, please take as many photos as you like! ðŸ“¸
